activities_info.details: Face Shield Manufacturing Fundraiser. One of our students located in New York has partnered with other medical students to create face shields for the healthcare workers in New York.
Girls Inc. Students will be creating virtual segments for high school age girls to participate in through the Girls Inc. Program.
Helping Hand COVID-19 Errand Services. A student-led errand service that a student founded in her hometown running errands for older adults, immunocompromised patients, and pregnant patients, etc.
Lessening the Distance with Letters. A letter program to foster community connection with vulnerable populations during COVID-19.

PPE Drive. A student-led PPE Drive to acquire needed resources for local hospitals and community organizations. We are collecting masks, gowns, gloves, shields, hand sanitizer, while supplementing with homemade masks.
READ Fort Worth. A collaboration with READ Fort Worth where we as medical students can record ourselves reading books to share with our community through different platforms.
Tarrant Country COVID-19 Hotline. Students are signing up and volunteering for 6 hours shifts taking questions for the COVID-19 Hotline through Tarrant Country.
Virtual Blood Drive. The virtual blood drive is coordinating blood donations across the country to help with the blood supply crisis.
We are currently providing supplemental childcare support to healthcare workers and their families by connecting graduate student volunteers to families in the Dallas-Fort Worth area in Texas.

directusSchool.name: TCU and UNTHSC School of Medicine
